title: Define Project Scope and Requirements (Revised)
description: Task for refining the requirements of the FutureScenariosGenerator system. This includes defining the types of scenarios to be generated, input data sources, output formats, target users, and use cases. Functional requirements such as real-time processing capabilities, security measures, scalability, and integration with existing systems should be outlined. Non-functional requirements like performance expectations, error handling, user interface design, and documentation are also crucial considerations. The deliverable will be a comprehensive document detailing the system's functional and non-functional requirements. This task requires in-depth understanding of the project's purpose and goals and may involve input from various team members including project manager, frontend-developer, backend-developer, database-specialist, devops-engineer, qa-tester, security-specialist, and technical-writer. To ensure a comprehensive and well-rounded document, it is important to encourage collaboration and discussion within the team. The RFC is in DRAFT state and awaiting further input and refinement.

title: Design System Architecture for FutureScenariosGenerator - Revised
description: Revise the design of the FutureScenariosGenerator system architecture, including components, data flows, and integration points with external systems. This design should consider scalability, reliability, and security in accordance with best practices for AI-powered systems. Additionally, outline strategies for handling large volumes of data, real-time scenario generation, discuss potential solutions for data privacy and security concerns, and address the implications of the system's AI capabilities on performance and resource allocation. Address any potential concerns related to data privacy and security in detail.

title: Develop Data Ingestion Pipeline
description: Implement a pipeline to ingest and preprocess data from various sources (e.g., news, social media, historical data) that will be used as input for scenario generation.

title: Implement Scenario Generation Model
description: Develop and train a machine learning model capable of generating plausible future scenarios based on the ingested data.

title: Build User Interface
description: Design and implement a user interface that allows users to input parameters, trigger scenario generation, and visualize the generated scenarios.

title: Implement Scenario Analysis and Reporting
description: Develop functionality to analyze and report on the generated scenarios, including identifying trends, risks, and opportunities.

title: Set up Testing and Continuous Integration
description: Establish a testing framework and continuous integration pipeline to ensure the quality and reliability of the system.

title: Implement Security and Access Controls
description: Design and implement robust security measures including encryption (AES-256 for data at rest and TLS for data in transit), authentication using OAuth 2.0, and role-based access control (RBAC) for user management. Implement multi-factor authentication for admin accounts, considering MFA methods such as SMS, email, or authenticator apps. Integrate with existing identity providers such as Okta or Auth0, ensuring seamless single sign-on (SSO). Consider using open-source libraries like Passport.js or similar for easy integration. Add a detailed logging and auditing system to track user actions and system events.

title: Deploy and Monitor the System
description: Set up the infrastructure and deploy the FutureScenariosGenerator system, including monitoring and logging mechanisms.
dependencies: Set up Testing and Continuous Integration

title: Create Documentation and User Guides
description: Develop comprehensive documentation and user guides to assist users in understanding and utilizing the FutureScenariosGenerator system.
